trans-unit.source: Contains a set of attributes associated with a particular <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubjectStatement.SamlSubject*>.
The SamlAttributeStatement class corresponds to the `<saml:AttributeStatement>` XML element that is defined in the OASIS SAML 1.1 specification.
The claims for SamlSecurityToken security tokens are contained in SAML statements, which are in turn contained within a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion>.
One such statement is the SamlAttributeStatement, which binds a set of arbitrary claims to a particular <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject>.
The claims are represented as a collection of <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute> and are stored in the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttributeStatement.Attributes%2A> property.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttributeStatement"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttributeStatement"></xref> class using the specified subject and set of attributes associated with the subject.
The following table specifies the properties set by the parameters to this constructor.

|Property|Parameter| |--------------|---------------| |<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttributeStatement.Attributes%2A>|`Attributes`| |<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubjectStatement.SamlSubject%2A>|`samlSubject`|
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject"></xref> that specifies the subject of the claim.
An <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable%601> of type <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute"></xref> that contains a set of attributes associated with the subject.
samlSubject is .
attributes contains a member that is .
-or- attributes contains zero members.
Adds the specified set of claims as attributes to this SAML statement.
Use the AddClaimsToList method to convert a set of claims into attributes of a SAML assertion.
An <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IList%601> of type <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim"></xref> that contains the set of claims to add to the SAML statement.
Gets a collection of attributes associated with the subject of the SAML assertion.
An <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IList%601> of type <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute"></xref> that contains a set of attributes associated with the subject.
Gets a value indicating whether the properties of this instance are read-only.
To make this instance of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttributeStatement> class read-only, call the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttributeStatement.MakeReadOnly%2A> method.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the properties of this instance are read-only; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Causes this instance to be read-only.
When the MakeReadOnly method is called, the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttributeStatement.IsReadOnly%2A> property is set to `true` and properties of this instance can no longer be set.
Reads the SAML attribute statement from the specified XML reader.
The ReadXml method sets the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttributeStatement.Attributes%2A> and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubjectStatement.SamlSubject%2A> properties.
An <xref:System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReader> to read the SAML attribute statement.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSerializer"></xref> that is capable of reading XML elements in the SAML attribute statement that is defined in the SAML specification.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenSerializer"></xref> that reads the <xref uid="langword_csharp_KeyInfo" name="KeyInfo" href=""></xref> clause of the digital signature.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenResolver"></xref> that determines the security token that created the digital signature.
reader is -or- samlSerializer is
reader refers to an XML element that does not contain a element -or- reader refers to an XML element that contains a element that does not have an attribute value.
Writes the SAML attribute statement into the specified XML serializer.
An <xref:System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter> to write the SAML attribute statement.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSerializer"></xref> that is capable of writing XML elements in a SAML assertion.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenSerializer"></xref> that is capable of writing <xref uid="langword_csharp_KeyInfo" name="KeyInfo" href=""></xref> clauses.
writer is -or- samlSerializer is
